messages.subject: Re: Covering the Basics (RSA)
messages.msgSnippet: Cathy is writing from South Africa.  RSA is the acronym for the Republic of South Africa. Joan
messages.messageBody:
Cathy is writing from South Africa. "RSA" is the acronym for the Republic of South Africa.

Joan


>
>
> + Problem though: In RSA one is supposed to be learning at least 2
> + languages,
> + and they should be official languages, ie English, Afrikaans and/or one of
> + the African languages.
>
> Are those your only choices? In Oklahoma, they have changed this
> requirement and there are some other, more unusual choices. I'm doing this
> from memory, but I'm pretty sure computer languages qualifies. And I know
> that American Sign Language qualifies. What is "RSA" anyway?
>
